channel.title: About on Jakub's tech blog
channel.description: Recent content in About on Jakub's tech blog

item.title: Projects
item.description: This is an overview of some of the projects I’ve done. Games Tag It! itch.io A platformer where you need to draw graffiti before you get caught! This is a submission to the Matfyz 2023 spring game jam, and somehow we ended up #1st place! Hyper Heist itch.io Hardcore fast-paced cyberpunk platformer. Submission to SpeedJam 1 organized by ScoreSpace, ended up #3rd overall and #1 organizers choice. No-Gun Shotgun itch.io

item.title: Dungeon of Quake Alpha
item.description: Dungeon of Quake is a Quake-like FPS, using Odin and Raylib github DoQ is currently in Alpha version - there are still a lot of bugs to fix and features to add. The initial development took ~1 month. screenshots dqmake DQMake is a super-simple tool for editing DoQ maps.

item.title: Reverse engineering Unity games
item.description: Few months ago, I made a level editor mod for Shady Knight, an action game with lots of movement, parkour and combat. I thought I could share a few things related to reverse engineering the game and modding. accessing source code For a game, all of the gameplay source code is stored in \SomeGame\SomeGame_Data\Managed\Assembly-CSharp.dll. This is a dll (dynamically-linked library), which is generated from source files when the game is built.
